person.persName: George Madison Adams, Jr. (Knox County, Kentucky, student, clerk, farmer, captain (U.S.A.) and major (U.S.A.))

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, student, clerk, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Richardson Adams and Jane Banten Adams. Student in Knox County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Knox County in 1850. Studied law at Centre College in Danville from 1854 to 1855. Clerk of the Knox Circuit Court in Knox County in 1860. Farmer in Knox County in 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from September 22, 1861, to his resignation on January 24,1863. Served as paymaster of volunteers (U.S.A.) with the rank of major in 1864.
